definition: building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]
erhua variant of 飯館|饭馆[fan4 guan3]

sentences.english: Cushman is director of marketing for a chain of Italian restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 庫什曼是一家連鎖意大利飯館的市場部總裁。

sentences.english: When I dine in a restaurant, I love a tcapable to myself.
sentences.chinese: 我上飯館喫飯時喜愛一獨立個體佔一張桌。

sentences.english: Actually, I know a great restaurant in Dongcheng.
sentences.chinese: 我知道東城有一家特好的飯館。

sentences.english: "This is often a very thankless job, " Legge says.
sentences.chinese: 萊格博士說“飯館服務員是個費力不討好的工作。

sentences.english: On the right from the lake there is a restaurant built of tuff.
sentences.chinese: 在湖的右岸有一排凝灰岩建造的房子，這是一家飯館。

sentences.english: Occasionally the dog will get scraps of bread and meat from the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 這隻狗偶爾能從飯館得到些殘羹剩飯。

sentences.english: I don't know that is a common joke or just that eatery's naming.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道這是普遍現象還是小飯館就愛這麼搞。

sentences.english: But at local restaurants, there's no need to add a  gratuity.
sentences.chinese: 但在當地的飯館裏，卻沒有心要附加小費。

sentences.english: Students often go Dutch in these restaurants on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 週末，學生常湊份子去這些飯館喫飯。

sentences.english: He take us for lunch to one of the posh restaurant in town.
sentences.chinese: 他帶我們到本城最高檔的一家飯館裏喫午餐。

sentences.english: This small restaurant should not be their hotel competitors?
sentences.chinese: 這個小飯館也不應該是他們大酒店的競爭對手吧？

sentences.english: The police ran down the thief in a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 警方在一個飯館裏抓到了這個小偷。

sentences.english: Xiang: Actually, I know a great restaurant in Dongcheng.
sentences.chinese: 我知道東城有一家特好的飯館。

sentences.english: You will be staying in this hotel during your visit in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 你在北京過訪時期就居住這家飯館裏。

sentences.english: The restaurant is patronized by John.
sentences.chinese: 約翰經常光顧這家飯館。

sentences.english: By the time we pulled up to Hotel Borghetti in Valpolicella, it was already 9 pm.
sentences.chinese: 等我們到達酒店時，已經9點多了，全城飯館都關了。

definition: to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
